definitions.definition: An absolving of sins from ecclesiastical penalties by an authority.
The forgiveness of sins , in a general sense.
The form of words by which a penitent is absolved .
An absolving , or setting free from guilt, sin, or penalty; forgiveness of an offense.
examples: Governments granting absolution to the nation.

definitions.definition: An acquittal , or sentence of a judge declaring an accused person innocent .
definitions.dating_raw: First attested in the early 17 century.

main_definition: ( ecclesiastical ) An absolving of sins from ecclesiastical penalties by an authority. [First attested around 1150 to 1350.]
secondary_definitions: The forgiveness of sins , in a general sense. [First attested around 1150 to 1350.]
The form of words by which a penitent is absolved . [First attested around 1350 to 1470.]
An absolving , or setting free from guilt, sin, or penalty; forgiveness of an offense. [First attested around 1350 to 1470.]
( civil law , obsolete ) An acquittal , or sentence of a judge declaring an accused person innocent . [First attested in the early 17 century.]
